title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A timeless novel that explores human morality and the perils of prejudice through the eyes of a young girl in the American South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian masterpiece that delves into the dangers of totalitarianism and extreme political ideology.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic romantic novel that examines themes of love, class, and reputation in 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A critique of the American Dream set in the Roaring Twenties, filled with glamour, love, and tragedy.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of man's obsession and the destructive pursuit of vengeance, centered around a legendary white whale.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage rebellion and alienation, narrated by the iconic Holden Caulfield.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A futuristic novel that explores the dangers of technological advancements and loss of individuality.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A prelude to the Lord of the Rings, chronicling Bilbo Baggins' adventurous journey.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel that intertwines personal and historical narratives during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical tale about following one's dreams and discovering personal legend.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A gripping exploration of morality, guilt, and redemption through the eyes of a tormented protagonist.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A haunting tale of survival and love between a father and son in a desolate world.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem chronicling Odysseus' journey home after the Trojan War.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: A monumental work of literature that explores the realms of Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A gothic novel that delves into the consequences of playing God and creating life.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A tale of vanity, moral corruption, and the pursuit of eternal youth.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A profound exploration of faith, doubt, and the human condition.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A classic novel about love, independence, and resilience in the face of adversity.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A haunting tale of passion, revenge, and the destructive power of love.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A thrilling story of betrayal, revenge, and redemption.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A gothic horror novel that introduced the iconic character of Count Dracula.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A sweeping tale of love, justice, and redemption set in 19th century France.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A poignant story of struggle, perseverance, and the human spirit.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A tragic love story that examines the complexities of human relationships.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A powerful depiction of the struggles of migrant workers during the Great Depression.

title: The Scarlet Letter
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
description: A tale of sin, guilt, and redemption set in Puritan New England.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A satirical novel about the adventures of a delusional knight-errant.

title: The Sun Also Rises
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel about the disillusionment and aimlessness of the Lost Generation.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A story of love, sacrifice, and redemption set during the French Revolution.

title: The Bell Jar
author: Sylvia Plath
description: A semi-autobiographical novel about mental illness and societal expectations.
